Complete Stage 5: 100-City GEFS-Aerosols Benchmark Data Collection

Successfully collected comprehensive benchmark forecasts for all 100 Stage 5 cities:
- 900 records with actual PM2.5/PM10 values extracted from GRIB2 files
- Global coverage: 20 cities each across Asia, Europe, N.America, Africa, S.America  
- Complete 48-hour forecast coverage (0-48h in 6-hour intervals)
- Zero data quality issues - all values within realistic atmospheric ranges
- NOMADS API integration with geographic subregion filtering
- Custom GRIB processor for air quality variable extraction
- Parquet output format for Stage 5 architecture compatibility

New files:
- scripts/collect_100city_benchmarks.py: Main collection orchestrator
- scripts/grib_processor.py: GRIB2 file processing utilities

Ready for CAMS benchmark collection and Stage 5 forecast evaluation.

Enhance GEFS aerosols collection infrastructure and documentation

Major enhancements to the GEFS-Aerosols forecasting system:
- Added comprehensive GEFS collection documentation (README_GEFS_COLLECTION.md)
- Implemented modular gefs_collection package with configuration management
- Enhanced GRIB2 processing with improved pollutant extraction capabilities
- Added literature review materials for atmospheric dispersion modeling
- Improved 100-city benchmark collection with refined data processing
- Updated provider documentation and system requirements
- Enhanced Stage 5 clean dataset generator with better error handling

New infrastructure supports scalable GEFS-Aerosols data collection and processing
for improved air quality forecasting accuracy across global urban centers.
